trans-unit.source: Using Scope in a Loop - How To
trans-unit.target: Using Scope in a Loop - How To

trans-unit.source: Using Scope in a Loop - How To
trans-unit.target: Using Scope in a Loop - How To

trans-unit.source: This topic describes using scope in <token>af_integration_full</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes using scope in <token>af_integration_full</token>.

trans-unit.source: Scope <token>transform</token> Design Area
trans-unit.target: Scope <token>transform</token> Design Area

trans-unit.source: Breadcrumb Trail
trans-unit.target: Breadcrumb Trail

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the <token>transform</token> Design area, the MapEach Loop scope hierarchy is displayed in the breadcrumb trail.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the <token>transform</token> Design area, the MapEach Loop scope hierarchy is displayed in the breadcrumb trail.

trans-unit.source: The current MapEach Loop scope is the last item in the breadcrumb trail.
trans-unit.target: The current MapEach Loop scope is the last item in the breadcrumb trail.

trans-unit.source: When scope is set in a MapEach Loop, the breadcrumb trail is updated to reflect the current hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: When scope is set in a MapEach Loop, the breadcrumb trail is updated to reflect the current hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> is the last MapEach Loop in the breadcrumb trail so it is the current set scope:
trans-unit.target: In the following example, <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> is the last MapEach Loop in the breadcrumb trail so it is the current set scope:

trans-unit.source: Container
trans-unit.target: Container

trans-unit.source: The MapEach Loop, ForEach Loop, and Create List operations have a container.
trans-unit.target: The MapEach Loop, ForEach Loop, and Create List operations have a container.

trans-unit.source: The child objects are grouped together in the container.
trans-unit.target: The child objects are grouped together in the container.

trans-unit.source: Items within the container are in the scope of the container and are executed within the scope of the container.
trans-unit.target: Items within the container are in the scope of the container and are executed within the scope of the container.

trans-unit.source: An inner container is a child of the outer container.
trans-unit.target: An inner container is a child of the outer container.

trans-unit.source: When a container is selected, a solid line is displayed around the container.
trans-unit.target: When a container is selected, a solid line is displayed around the container.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, <legacyBold>Dept Mapping</legacyBold> is selected so its container has the solid line:
trans-unit.target: In the following example, <legacyBold>Dept Mapping</legacyBold> is selected so its container has the solid line:

trans-unit.source: Collapse and Expand
trans-unit.target: Collapse and Expand

trans-unit.source: Each container can be collapsed and expanded in two ways:
trans-unit.target: Each container can be collapsed and expanded in two ways:

trans-unit.source: Select the container and press the SPACE bar.
trans-unit.target: Select the container and press the SPACE bar.

trans-unit.source: Select the minus (-) to collapse and the plus sign (+) to expand.
trans-unit.target: Select the minus (-) to collapse and the plus sign (+) to expand.

trans-unit.source: Collapsing the container automatically unsets the MapEach Loop scope.
trans-unit.target: Collapsing the container automatically unsets the MapEach Loop scope.

trans-unit.source: Adding <token>mapop</token>s to a container can only be done when the container is expanded.
trans-unit.target: Adding <token>mapop</token>s to a container can only be done when the container is expanded.

trans-unit.source: Modifying links can be done when the container is collapsed or expanded.
trans-unit.target: Modifying links can be done when the container is collapsed or expanded.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> is collapsed and the <embeddedLabel>Containing Scope</embeddedLabel> property automatically goes to its parent node, which is <legacyBold>Dept Mapping</legacyBold>:
trans-unit.target: In the following example, <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> is collapsed and the <embeddedLabel>Containing Scope</embeddedLabel> property automatically goes to its parent node, which is <legacyBold>Dept Mapping</legacyBold>:

trans-unit.source: Container Header
trans-unit.target: Container Header

trans-unit.source: When the MapEach scope is set, the container header is highlighted.
trans-unit.target: When the MapEach scope is set, the container header is highlighted.

trans-unit.source: These colors are modified using the following steps:
trans-unit.target: These colors are modified using the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Go to the <legacyBold>Tools</legacyBold> menu and select <legacyBold>Options</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Go to the <legacyBold>Tools</legacyBold> menu and select <legacyBold>Options</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Expand <legacyBold><token>transform</token>s Designer</legacyBold> and select <legacyBold>Colors & Fonts</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Expand <legacyBold><token>transform</token>s Designer</legacyBold> and select <legacyBold>Colors & Fonts</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Select <legacyBold>Working Scope Header Background</legacyBold> to change its color.
trans-unit.target: Select <legacyBold>Working Scope Header Background</legacyBold> to change its color.

trans-unit.source: Select <legacyBold>OK</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Select <legacyBold>OK</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Direct Links with Repeating Records
trans-unit.target: Direct Links with Repeating Records

trans-unit.source: When linking a repeating record in the source document to a repeating record in the target document, a MapEach Loop is needed.
trans-unit.target: When linking a repeating record in the source document to a repeating record in the target document, a MapEach Loop is needed.

trans-unit.source: Creating these links from each source node to the target node is often time consuming.
trans-unit.target: Creating these links from each source node to the target node is often time consuming.

trans-unit.source: As a result, <token>af_integration</token> includes Direct Link functionality.
trans-unit.target: As a result, <token>af_integration</token> includes Direct Link functionality.

trans-unit.source: Direct Linking is simply copying from an input node to an output node, with no other processing.
trans-unit.target: Direct Linking is simply copying from an input node to an output node, with no other processing.

trans-unit.source: Direct Linking is also used when linking non-repeating records; which does not require a MapEach Loop.
trans-unit.target: Direct Linking is also used when linking non-repeating records; which does not require a MapEach Loop.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="42b6bb45-6c49-466a-aed6-88811f0e40a1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Loop Operations</link> describes the Direct Link functionality.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="42b6bb45-6c49-466a-aed6-88811f0e40a1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Loop Operations</link> describes the Direct Link functionality.

trans-unit.source: Page
trans-unit.target: Page

trans-unit.source: Container Scope is per Page.
trans-unit.target: Container Scope is per Page.

trans-unit.source: When scope is set on a MapEach Loop in Page 1, selecting Page 2 sets scope on Home in Page 2.
trans-unit.target: When scope is set on a MapEach Loop in Page 1, selecting Page 2 sets scope on Home in Page 2.

trans-unit.source: Highlight Propagation
trans-unit.target: Highlight Propagation

trans-unit.source: When you select a container, the source and target node links are highlighted in green.
trans-unit.target: When you select a container, the source and target node links are highlighted in green.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the <legacyBold>Company Mapping</legacyBold>, <legacyBold>Dept Mapping</legacyBold>, and <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> scopes are set.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, the <legacyBold>Company Mapping</legacyBold>, <legacyBold>Dept Mapping</legacyBold>, and <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> scopes are set.

trans-unit.source: The breadcrumb trail shows the MapEach Loop hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: The breadcrumb trail shows the MapEach Loop hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> is the last item in the breadcrumb trail and is therefore the current scope.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> is the last item in the breadcrumb trail and is therefore the current scope.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> node is highlighted in green:
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> node is highlighted in green:

trans-unit.source: To modify or turn off the highlighting
trans-unit.target: To modify or turn off the highlighting

trans-unit.source: On the <legacyBold>Tools</legacyBold> menu, select <legacyBold>Options</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: On the <legacyBold>Tools</legacyBold> menu, select <legacyBold>Options</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Select <legacyBold>Transforms Designer</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Select <legacyBold>Transforms Designer</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: To turn off the highlighting feature, select <legacyBold>General</legacyBold>, and clear the <legacyBold>Highlight Propagation</legacyBold> option.
trans-unit.target: To turn off the highlighting feature, select <legacyBold>General</legacyBold>, and clear the <legacyBold>Highlight Propagation</legacyBold> option.

trans-unit.source: To modify the highlighting colors, select <legacyBold>Colors & Fonts</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: To modify the highlighting colors, select <legacyBold>Colors & Fonts</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Containing Scope
trans-unit.target: Containing Scope

trans-unit.source: When a child loop is selected, the <legacyBold>Containing Scope</legacyBold> property is updated with the Label name of the parent scope.
trans-unit.target: When a child loop is selected, the <legacyBold>Containing Scope</legacyBold> property is updated with the Label name of the parent scope.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, <legacyBold>Dept Mapping</legacyBold> is selected, and the <legacyBold>Containing Scope</legacyBold> property displays <legacyBold>Company Mapping</legacyBold>, which is the parent node:
trans-unit.target: In the following example, <legacyBold>Dept Mapping</legacyBold> is selected, and the <legacyBold>Containing Scope</legacyBold> property displays <legacyBold>Company Mapping</legacyBold>, which is the parent node:

trans-unit.source: Home
trans-unit.target: Home

trans-unit.source: Selecting <legacyBold>Home</legacyBold> in the breadcrumb trail puts the scope at the Page.
trans-unit.target: Selecting <legacyBold>Home</legacyBold> in the breadcrumb trail puts the scope at the Page.

trans-unit.source: No scope is set and the <legacyBold>Containing Scope</legacyBold> property displays None:
trans-unit.target: No scope is set and the <legacyBold>Containing Scope</legacyBold> property displays None:

trans-unit.source: Cut, Copy & Paste
trans-unit.target: Cut, Copy & Paste

trans-unit.source: <token>mapop</token>s are movable using Cut/Copy and Paste.
trans-unit.target: <token>mapop</token>s are movable using Cut/Copy and Paste.

trans-unit.source: Links are not movable using Cut/Copy and Paste.
trans-unit.target: Links are not movable using Cut/Copy and Paste.

trans-unit.source: If you move a <token>mapop</token> using Cut/Copy and Paste, the links are removed.
trans-unit.target: If you move a <token>mapop</token> using Cut/Copy and Paste, the links are removed.

trans-unit.source: To move <token>mapop</token>s and their links, use <legacyBold>Ctrl + Click</legacyBold> to select the items to move.
trans-unit.target: To move <token>mapop</token>s and their links, use <legacyBold>Ctrl + Click</legacyBold> to select the items to move.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Ctrl + Click</legacyBold> cuts the items and then you paste to the desired location.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Ctrl + Click</legacyBold> cuts the items and then you paste to the desired location.

trans-unit.source: <token>mapop</token>s and links cannot be dragged and dropped.
trans-unit.target: <token>mapop</token>s and links cannot be dragged and dropped.

trans-unit.source: Exit a Scope
trans-unit.target: Exit a Scope

trans-unit.source: To exit a MapEach Loop scope, do any of the following:
trans-unit.target: To exit a MapEach Loop scope, do any of the following:

trans-unit.source: Unset scope <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="fac35ba9-5681-4b98-9237-58d97b58dbef" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline>.
trans-unit.target: Unset scope <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="fac35ba9-5681-4b98-9237-58d97b58dbef" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline>.

trans-unit.source: This option moves the focus up one MapEach Loop scope in the hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: This option moves the focus up one MapEach Loop scope in the hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, <legacyBold ></legacyBold> scope is set:
trans-unit.target: In the following example, <legacyBold ></legacyBold> scope is set:

trans-unit.source: Then, the <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> MapEach Loop scope is unset.
trans-unit.target: Then, the <legacyBold>Employee Mapping</legacyBold> MapEach Loop scope is unset.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>Dept Mapping</legacyBold> MapEach Loop scope is the last item in the breadcrumb trail and is the current scope:
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Dept Mapping</legacyBold> MapEach Loop scope is the last item in the breadcrumb trail and is the current scope:

trans-unit.source: Select any parent scope in the breadcrumb trail.
trans-unit.target: Select any parent scope in the breadcrumb trail.

trans-unit.source: For example, select Dept Mapping in the Breadcrumb Trail:
trans-unit.target: For example, select Dept Mapping in the Breadcrumb Trail:

trans-unit.source: Set a different scope.
trans-unit.target: Set a different scope.
